column1: To create sensitivity tables in Google Sheets:
1. Set up a data table with cap rates in column A
2. In cell B1, reference your Stabilized Value formula
3. Select the range including headers and data
4. Go to Data then Data Table (or use manual formulas)
5. For Cap Rate sensitivity: NOI/A2 (where A2 is the cap rate)
Create an Inputs section with these cells that feed into formulas:

column2: Create named ranges for key inputs (e.g., AcquisitionPrice, CapRate) for easier formula reading
Highlight negative values in red, positive in green
Add mini charts to show sensitivity ranges
Use INDIRECT("Option"&A1&"!B5") to reference cells across sheets dynamically
